identificationModule.briefTitle: Intervention With Vitamin D and Omega-3 Supplements and Incident Heart Failure
identificationModule.officialTitle: Intervention With Vitamin D and Omega-3 Supplements and Incident Heart Failure

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Director of Research, Associate Professor of Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study will examine whether an intervention with vitamin D or fish oil supplements can reduce the risk of heart failure among adult men and women during a follow up period of up to five years (starting from the time of randomization into the parent VITAL trial). The investigators hypotheses are that both vitamin D and fish oil supplements will each reduce the risk of heart failure.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: For this ancillary study of the ongoing parent VITAL trial, we will adjudicate incident heart failure cases occurring during a time period of up to five years starting from randomization of subjects in the parent VITAL study. Intention-to-treat analysis will be used to assess the efficacy of vitamin D as well as omega-3 fatty acids.

armGroups.description: 2000 IU per day and 1 g per day of fish oil

interventions.description: 2000 IU vitamin D and 1g/d fish oil

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Vitamin D placebo and fish oil placebo
armGroupLabels: Fish oil and vitamin D placebo

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With New Heart Failure Hospitalization
primaryOutcomes.description: We will consider any hospitalization for heart failure among participants enrolled in the parent VITAL trial for this ancillary study. Incident heart failure are initially captured through annual questionnaires with subsequent validation by a team of physicians with expertise in cardiovascular medicine and epidemiology. We excluded 36 participants with prevalent heart failure at the time of randomization for the primary analysis.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Recurrent Heart Failure Hospitalization
secondaryOutcomes.description: Recurrent heart failure hospitalizations ascertained either by review of medical records and/or use of CMS (Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services) data.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: The trial included a 3-month placebo run-in period to select participants likely to have excellent compliance. Only individuals who reported taking at least 2/3 of their study pills during the run-in and met other eligibility criteria were randomized into the trial.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: A total of 401605 adults were initially screened; 39430 eligible to enter run-in; 25871 eligible for randomization; 2x2 factorial design: 12927 assigned to active vit D (of these, 6463 were assigned to active omega-3 FAs and 6464 to placebo omega-3 FAs) \& 12944 assigned to placebo vit D (of these, 6470 were assigned to active omega-3 FAs and 6474 to placebo omega-3 FAs)

groups.title: Active Vitamin D + Active Omega-3 Fatty Acids
groups.description: Active Vitamin D = Vitamin D3, one 2000 IU capsule/day; Active Omega-3 Fatty Acids = Omacor, one 1-gram capsule/day. Each capsule of Omacor contains 840 milligrams of marine omega-3 fatty acids (465 mg of eicosapentaenoic acid \[EPA\] and 375 mg of docosahexaenoic acid \[DHA\]).

groups.title: Active Vitamin D + Placebo Omega-3 Fatty Acids
groups.description: Active Vitamin D = Vitamin D3, one 2000 IU capsule/day; Placebo Omega-3 Fatty Acids, one capsule/day

groups.title: Placebo Vitamin D + Active Omega-3 Fatty Acids
groups.description: Placebo Vitamin D, one capsule/day; Active Omega-3 Fatty Acids = Omacor, one 1-gram capsule/day. Each capsule of Omacor contains 840 milligrams of marine omega-3 fatty acids (465 mg of eicosapentaenoic acid \[EPA\] and 375 mg of docosahexaenoic acid \[DHA\]).

groups.title: Placebo Vitamin D + Placebo Omega-3 Fatty Acids
groups.description: Placebo Vitamin D, one capsule/day; Placebo Omega-3 Fatty Acids, one capsule/day

measures.populationDescription: Not all participants provided information on race/ethnicity; hence the discrepancy between number reported under race/ethnicity and total number enrolled.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With New Heart Failure Hospitalization
outcomeMeasures.description: We will consider any hospitalization for heart failure among participants enrolled in the parent VITAL trial for this ancillary study. Incident heart failure are initially captured through annual questionnaires with subsequent validation by a team of physicians with expertise in cardiovascular medicine and epidemiology. We excluded 36 participants with prevalent heart failure at the time of randomization for the primary analysis.

outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Each participant is allowed to have multiple heart failure hospitalizations.

adverseEventsModule.description: Conditions monitored for Vit D: kidney stones, hypercalcemia, parathyroid disease, kidney failure or dialysis; Other symptoms/side effects: gastrointestinal (GI) bleed, easy bruising; stomach upset or pain; nausea; constipation, diarrhea, skin rash Conditions monitored for omega-3: GI bleed; blood in urine; easy bruising; nosebleeds; kidney failure or dialysis; Other side effects: stomach upset or pain; nausea; constipation; diarrhea; skin rash; bad taste in mouth; increased burping
